title: Oh, The Places You'll Go! Dr. Suess Takes Over This Georgia Resort
text:
Oh, The Places You'll Go! Dr. Suess Takes Over This Georgia Resort Brittany Jones Cooper Editor, Yahoo Travel July 9, 2015 
The “Cat in the Hat” Large-Scale Bronze. (Photo: Dr. Seuss Enterprises) 
It’s July, and you know what that means…Christmas is just six months away! 
This winter, Sea Island resort in Georgia will transform into Who-ville with décor inspired by How the Grinch Stole Christmas . But in the meantime, they are giving visitors a sneak peak into the world of Dr. Seuss with a rare and quirky exhibit. 
For a limited-time only, the Ann Jackson Gallery at Sea Island’s Beach Club will be home to The Art of Dr. Seuss , which showcases original works from the famous author. The show will run from July 9 to August 4, and includes highlights like a 170-pound Cat In The Hat bronze sculpture and works from his Secret Art Collection . 
Related: Grinch-Proof Christmas Destinations People Want to Visit Most 
If your kids are looking for their own Cat in the Hat souvenir,they can even make a top hat modeled after the iconic red and white one worn by the world’s favorite feline. 
This winter, Sea Island will take things a step farther by transforming the resort into a wintry Who-ville wonderland with tree trimming, ornament making and cookie creations all inspired by the Whos. The Grinch will also be on hand, serving as the Grinchy Marshal of Sea Island’s annual Reindog Parade. 
Rates at The Cloister at Sea Island and The Lodge at Sea Island start at $395/night and rates for The Inn at Sea Island start at $185/night.
